summary: This document is a checklist of materials and procedures for conducting a suicide reconstruction investigation within the Bureau of Prisons, dated June 2013. It outlines the extensive documentation required, including inmate records, surveillance, staff reports, and evidence logs, to thoroughly review an inmate death by suicide. It is a procedural guide, not a case-specific report.
keyFacts: The document is a standardized Bureau of Prisons checklist titled 'National Suicide Prevention Program Suicide Reconstruction Materials' dated June 2013.

It details the extensive evidence and documentation required for a formal reconstruction of an inmate suicide, including securing the scene, collecting electronic data (TRU-INTEL/TRU VIEW reports), video, staff memoranda, and full inmate records.
The procedure mandates coordination by a single point of contact, typically the Special Investigative Agent (SIA), and the creation of a permanent record binder for the reconstruction team.

Required materials span operational logs (sentry documentation, staff sign-in), inmate files (medical, psychological, disciplinary), official reports (police, FBI referral, autopsy), and physical evidence (notes, property).
The document is a generic procedural guide and does not contain information specific to any individual case, including that of Jeffrey Epstein.
